text: {{Infobox writer | name = Peter Handke | image = Peter-handke.jpg | birth_date = | birth_place = Griffen, Austria | occupation = Novelist, Playwright | nationality = Austrian | notableworks = The Goalie's Anxiety at the Penalty Kick, Slow Homecoming | signature = Signature of Peter Handke.svg }} Peter Handke (born December 6, 1942 in Griffen (Carinthia)) is an Austrian author and translator of books. Peter Handke is known for his extremely critical (and perhaps even absurd) plays. Perhaps his best-known play is called Publikumsbeschimpfung (translates roughly as insulting /offending the audience). The play consists of actors insulting and offending the audience, and later congratulating them for the good performance. The play has been labelled as antitheater. In 2019, Handke was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature.nobelprize.org ==Note== ==Other websites== *Peter Handke, Song of childhood * *"A son's long good-bye", Svenska Dagbladet, Karl-Erik Tallmo, September 23, 1988 Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Austrian Nobel Prize winners Category:Austrian writers Category:European translators Category:People from Carinthia (state)
